children.label: planetary_surface
children.definition: A planetary surface is a surface layer where the solid or liquid material of a planet comes into contact with an atmosphere or outer space.

children.label: sea_ice
children.definition: Water ice which has formed by the freezing of sea water.

children.label: albedo
children.definition: A reflective quality restricted to a particular wavelength.

children.label: snow
children.definition: Snow is an environmental material which is primarily composed of flakes of crystalline water ice.

children.label: temperature
children.definition: A physical quality of the thermal energy of a system.

children.label: vegetation
children.definition: A layer which is determined by a form of vegetation.

children.label: soil
children.definition: Soil is an environmental material which is primarily composed of minerals, varying proportions of sand, silt, and clay, organic material such as humus, gases, liquids, and a broad range of resident micro- and macroorganisms

children.label: albedo
children.definition: A reflective quality restricted to a particular wavelength

children.label: canopy
children.definition: A vegetation layer which is formed by a collection of individual plant crowns, themselves constituting part of the aboveground portion of a plant community.

children.label: albedo
children.definition: A reflective quality restricted to a particular wavelength.

children.label: land
children.definition: Land is a planetary surface that is not covered by liquid.

children.label: direction
children.definition: A physical quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's orientation in space.

children.label: slope
children.definition: A solid astronomical body part which is part of the planetary surface between the peak of an elevation or the bottom of a depression and relatively flat surrounding land.

children.label: planetary_surface_overcast_sky
children.definition: A planetary surface is a surface layer where the solid or liquid material of a planet comes into contact with an atmosphere or outer space.

children.label: ultraviolet_radiation
children.definition: A radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted at wavelengths between 10 nm and 400 nm.

children.label: atmosphere-over_land_surface
children.definition: An atmosphere is a layer of gases surrounding a material body of sufficient mass that is held in place by the gravity of the body.

children.label: atmosphere-at_cloud_top
children.definition: An atmosphere is a layer of gases surrounding a material body of sufficient mass that is held in place by the gravity of the body.

children.label: atmosphere-top
children.definition: An atmosphere is a layer of gases surrounding a material body of sufficient mass that is held in place by the gravity of the body.

children.label: air
children.definition: The mixture of gases (roughly (by molar content/volume: 78% nitrogen, 20.95% oxygen, 0.93% argon, 0.038% carbon dioxide, trace amounts of other gases, and a variable amount (average around 1%) of water vapor) that surrounds the planet Earth.

children.label: pressure
children.definition: A physical quality that inheres in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's amount of force per unit area it exerts.

children.label: ambient_aerosol_particles
children.definition: Airborne solid particles (also called dust or particulate matter (PM)) or liquid droplets.

children.label: ocean
children.definition: A marine water body which is constitutes the majority of an astronomical body's hydrosphere.

children.label: hydrological_evaporation
children.definition: Hydrological evaporation is the evaporation of water, generally as part of a planetary water cycle.

children.label: sea_ice
children.definition: Water ice which has formed by the freezing of sea water.

children.definition: A reflective quality restricted to a particular wavelength.

children.label: volume
children.definition: A 3-D extent quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's amount of 3-dimensional space it occupies.

children.label: vegetation
children.definition: A layer which is determined by a form of vegetation.

children.label: atmosphere-at_convective_cloud_base
children.definition: An atmosphere is a layer of gases surrounding a material body of sufficient mass that is held in place by the gravity of the body.

children.label: cloud_top
children.definition: A cloud is a visible mass of aerosolised liquid droplets or frozen crystals suspended in an atmosphere above the surface of a planetary body.

children.label: atmospheric_wind
children.definition: A mass gaseous flow which occurrs in a planet's atmosphere due to internal pressure disequilibria.

children.label: mean_sea_level
children.definition: A elevation quality which inheres in a marine water body by virtue of the position of that water body's surface layer (adjacent to an atmosphere) relative to some reference elevation.

children.label: volcanic_ash_cloud_top
children.definition: Volcanic ash is an environmental material which consists of fragments of pulverized rock, minerals, and volcanic glass, created during volcanic eruptions and measuring less than 2 millimetres in diameter. Volcanic ash is formed during explosive volcanic eruptions, phreatomagmatic eruptions and during transport in pyroclastic density currents.

children.label: ice_flow

children.label: permafrost
children.definition: Soil or rock and included ice or organic material at or below the freezing point of water (0 degrees Celsius or 32 degrees Fahrenheit) for two or more years.
